required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating Safety and Tolerability of Inotuzumab Ozogamicin (CMC-544) in Japanese Patients With B-cell Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma (NHL)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Study Of CMC-544 Administered As A Single Agent In Subjects With B-Cell Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the tolerability and the initial safety profile of Inotuzumab Ozogamicin (CMC-544) in patients with B-Cell Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma (NHL).

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence and severity of adverse events, dose-limiting toxicities, and changes in laboratory test results.

secondary_outcome.measure: Tumor response (according to the International Response Criteria for Non-Hodgkin's Lymphomas).

intervention.description: Intravenous (IV) infusion, 1.3 - 1.8 mg/m2, every 28 days, 4 cycles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- CD22-positive, B-cell NHL which has progressed after 1 or 2 prior therapies.
- Patients who have progressed after at least 1 prior chemotherapy regimen for indolent lymphoma, or 1/ 2 chemotherapy regimens, which include anthracylin or anthraquinon for aggressive lymphoma.
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status: 0/ 1.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients must not have received monoclonal antibodies or radioimmunoconjugates within 3 months before first dose of test article.
- Patients must not have received bilateral pelvic irradiation.
- Patients must not have received chemotherapy, cancer immunosuppressive therapy, growth factors (except erythropoietin), or investigational agents within 4 weeks before first dose of test article.
